multi-sectoral-ncd-taskforce.title: Multi-sectoral NCD taskforce

values.not-present: A multi-sectoral NCD taskforce covering the 4 main NCD risk factors (tobacco, alcohol, nutrition, physical activity) has not been established, or is inactive (less than 2 meetings in last 12 months).
values.under-development: There is evidence that a multi-sectoral NCD Taskforce is being established, or a taskforce exists and has had at least 2 meetings in the last 12 months but no public reports are available
values.present: Multi-sectoral NCD taskforce has had at least 2 meetings in last 12 months, and annual report (or equivalent) is available
values.low: As for , and 1 of the items listed below
values.medium: As for , and 2 of the items listed below
values.high: As for , and 3 of the items listed below
not-applicable: The taskforce is led by a Government Minister or Prime Minister
NCD taskforce demonstrates decision making, and monitors implementation and publicly documents its actions

Taskforce includes senior representation from Government sectors such as: Attorney General, and ministries of Agriculture, Communications, Customs and Excise, Education, Finance and Economic Planning, Health, Labour & Industry, Sport, National Statistics, Trade, Police, Urban Planning and National Statistics Office (at least 5).
Taskforce includes Civil Society and Non-Government Organisations

Platform has established mechanisms for engagement with the private sector (with conflicts of interest managed), EXCLUDING the tobacco industry. Private sector engagement can be through the taskforce or at national level.

multi-sectoral-ncd-taskforce.indicator-description: A multi-sectoral taskforce is operating, reports regularly,is inclusive of all relevant stakeholders, and is catalysing and monitoring actions on NCDs

national-strategy-addressing-ncds-and-ri.title: National strategy addressing NCDs and risk factors

values.not-present: There is no current national multi-sectoral strategy for tackling NCDs
values.under-development: There is evidence that a national multi-sectoral strategy is under development OR one exists but is not operational
values.present: A multi-sectoral NCD strategy has been developed (either stand-alone or part of a wider national health plan) to cover at least two individual diseases (cardiovascular disease, diabetes, cancer, respiratory disease) and two risk factors (tobacco, alcohol, nutrition, physical activity), AND is operational
values.low: A multi-sectoral NCD strategy has been developed, is operational, and covers at least four individual diseases and four risk factors
values.medium: As for , and 2 of the items listed below
values.high: As for , and demonstrates engagement of non-health agencies in development of the strategy, has a monitoring and surveillance plan, and one other item from the list below
not-applicable: Includes a comprehensive set of policies and actions translated from agreed global, regional and national frameworks
Evident responsibilities, timelines and accountability mechanisms
Evident budget allocations (in plans or government budgets)
Evident monitoring and surveillance plan

values.not-present: A multi-sectoral NCD taskforce covering the 4 main NCD risk factors (tobacco, alcohol, nutrition, physical activity) has not been established, or is inactive (less than 2 meetings in last 12 months).
values.under-development: There is evidence that a multi-sectoral NCD Taskforce is being established, ora taskforce exists and has had at least 2 meetings in the last 12 months but no public reports are available
values.present: Multi-sectoral NCD taskforce has had at least 2 meetings in last 12 months, and annual report (or equivalent) is available
values.low: As for , and 1 of the items listed below
values.medium: As for , and 2 of the items listed below
values.high: As for , and 3 of the items listed below
